sen.j: 多田 経実（ただ つねざね、生没年不詳）は鎌倉時代初期の武士。
sen.e: Tsunezane TADA (date of birth and death unknown) was a samurai in the early Kamakura period.
Tsunezane TADA (date of birth and death unknown) was a samurai in the early Kamakura period.
Tsunezane TADA (date of birth and death unknown) was a samurai in the early Kamakura period.
He was the originator of the Tada clan of Yamato Province.
He was the originator of the Tada clan of Yamato Province.
He was the originator of the Tada clan of Yamato Province.

sen.j: 摂津源氏の嫡流であった多田氏の一族で、源満仲（多田満仲）の8代孫にあたる源高頼の子とされる（『尊卑分脈』等の系図では経実の名は確認出来ない）。
sen.e: There is a theory that states that he belonged to the Tada clan, the main branch of Settsu-Genji (Minamoto clan), and he was a child of MINAMOTO no Takayori, the eighth grandson of MINAMOTO no Mitsunaka (TADA no Manju) (the name of Tsunezane is not confirmed in the family tree in "Sonpibunmyaku" and others), but there is another theory that states that he belonged to the Nakamura clan of Hirose-gun, Yamato Province, and his pedigree record was uncertain.

It is believed that he was from Tada clan, which was the direct descendant of the Settsu-Genji (Minamoto clan), and was the eighth grandson of MINAMOTO no Mitsunaka (TADA no Manju) and the son of MINAMOTO no Takayori (the name of Tsunezane is not confirmed in the family trees including "Sonpi Bunmyaku" (a text compiled in the fourteenth century that records the lineages of the aristocracy)), however he is also said to come from Nakamura clan of Hirose-gun, Yamato Province, and his pedigree record is uncertain.
sen.cmt: 原文が分かりにくいのですが、「源満仲の8代孫にあたる源高頼の子」は、「源満仲の8代孫にあたる『源高頼の子』」という意味で、源高頼が8代孫ということではありません（源高頼は源満仲から7代目）。Trans1ではその違いが分かりにくいので、書き換えました。ただ、8代孫を8代目ととって良いのかは不明です。his pedigree record was uncertain.をis pedigree record is uncertain.と変えました（はっきりしないのは現在においてなので）。『尊卑分脈』の補足が抜けていました。
sen.e: It is believed that he was from Tada clan, which was the direct descendant of the Settsu-Genji (Minamoto clan), and was the eighth generation of the decendent of MINAMOTO no Mitsunaka (TADA no Manju) and the son of MINAMOTO no Takayori (the name of Tsunezane is not confirmed in the family trees including "Sonpi Bunmyaku" [a text compiled in the fourteenth century that records the lineages of the aristocracy]).
sen.cmt: ２文に分けました。一原文一訳文の例外対処()内の括弧を[]にしました。the eighth grandson of MINAMOTO no Mitsunaka (TADA no Manju) and the son of MINAMOTO no Takayori →the eighth generation of the decendent of MINAMOTO no Mitsunaka (TADA no Manju)

sen.j: が、大和国広瀬郡中村氏の一族ともいわれ系譜ははっきりしない。
sen.e: However he is also said to come from Nakamura clan of Hirose County, Yamato Province, and his pedigree record is uncertain.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処Hirose-gun→Hirose County

sen.j: 多田氏は元暦2年（1185年）に累代の所領であった多田荘を失っており、一族であった経実は建保年間（1213年 - 1218年）に本貫の摂津より大和国宇陀郡多田（奈良県宇陀市室生区多田）の地に移り住んで土着したとされる。
sen.e: The Tada clan lost the Tada-no-sho estate, which was a territory of the successive generations, Tsunezane TADA moved from his birthplace Settsu to Tada, Uda-gun, Yamato Province (Tada, Murou-ku, Uda City, Nara Prefecture) in the Kempo era (1213 to 1218) and settled there.

The Tada clan lost the Tada-no-sho estate, which was their territory for generations; therefore Tsunezane TADA moved from his birthplace Settsu to Tada, Uda-gun, Yamato Province (Tada, Murou-ku, Uda City, Nara Prefecture) in the Kempo era (1213 to 1218) and settled there.
sen.cmt: was a territory of the successive generationsをwas their territory for generationsと変えました。文中にthereforeと入れました。
sen.e: The Tada clan lost the Tada-no-sho estate, which was their territory for generations; therefore Tsunezane TADA moved from his birthplace Settsu to Tada, Uda-gun, Yamato Province (Tada, Murou-ku, Uda City, Nara Prefecture) in the Kempo era (1213 to 1218) and settled there.

sen.j: 以降、経実の子孫は大和国東山内地方の有力国人として中世を通して存続した。
sen.e: Afterwards, descendents of Tsunezane survived as powerful local lords (kokujin) in the Higashiyama inland of Yamato Province in the medieval period.
Afterwards, descendents of Tsunezane continued as powerful local lords (kokujin) in the Higashiyama inland of Yamato Province through out the medieval period.
sen.cmt: 存続したをsurvivedだと生き延びた、といったニュアンスになり、「有力国人として」と若干ずれてしまうので、continuedとしました。「中世を通して」なので、in the medieval periodではなく、through out the medieval periodとかえました。
sen.e: Afterwards, descendents of Tsunezane continued as powerful local lords (kokujin) in the Higashiyama inland of Yamato Province through out the medieval period.
